content:
• Wednesday, October 24, 2012
  • MWA

    Mueller Water Products (NYSE:MWA) declares $0.0175/share quarterly dividend, in line with...

    Mueller Water Products (NYSE:MWA) declares $0.0175/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 1.49%. For shareholders of record Nov 09. Payable Nov 21. Ex-div date Nov 07. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 PM

    Tellabs (NASDAQ:TLAB): Q3 EPS of $0.02 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $264M (-20% Y/Y) misses by $12M. Shares +1.9% AH. (PR)

    R.R. Donnelley & Sons Company (NASDAQ:RRD) declares $0.26/share quarterly dividend, in line...

    R.R. Donnelley & Sons Company (NASDAQ:RRD) declares $0.26/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 10.47%. For shareholders of record Nov 08. Payable Dec 03. Ex-div date Nov 06. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • ANGI

    More on Angie's List's Q3: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $45M-$46M, in-line with a $45.6M...

    More on Angie's List's Q3: Q4 guidance is for revenue of $45M-$46M, in-line with a $45.6M consensus. Total paid memberships +16% Q/Q and +68% Y/Y to 1.66M. Gross membership adds were 341K, up from Q2's 305K. Total service provider contract value +17% Q/Q to $119.1M. The Street must be pleased marketing cost per new paid subscriber fell to $76 from Q2's $91. ANGI +14.4% AH, shares had been clobbered in recent months.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMO

    More on Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) Q3 earnings: Net interest margin declines 20 basis points...

    More on Capstead Mortgage (NYSE:CMO) Q3 earnings: Net interest margin declines 20 basis points to 1.3%. Falling yields on MBS killed returns, but drove book value higher. Constant prepayment rate (CPR) of 18.7%, a big jump from Q2's 15.9%. Company believes its holdings of ARMs make it less exposed to falling rates as the average rate on its mortgages is already just 3.37%. Earnings call tomorrow at 9 ET. Shares +1.4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ZNGA +12.3%; ANGI +10%; SYMC +7.1%; INFN +6.4%; SKX...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: ZNGA +12.3%; ANGI +10%; SYMC +7.1%; INFN +6.4%; SKX +6%.
    After-hours top losers: FIO -11.1%; FFIV -10.5%; MKSI -9.6%; TRN -8.2%; CROX -7.4%.

  • SYMC

    More on Symantec's FQ2: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $1.72B-$1.75B and EPS of $0.36-$0.38 vs....

    More on Symantec's FQ2: FQ3 guidance is for revenue of $1.72B-$1.75B and EPS of $0.36-$0.38 vs. a consensus of $1.72B and $0.42. The soft EPS guidance is blamed on "investments to better serve customers" - could Symantec's CEO change be responsible? Deferred revenue +5% Y/Y to $3.62B. EMEA -4% Y/Y, but Asia-Pac +6%. Consumer revenue (anti-virus software) -1%, enterprise security software +6%, storage/server management software -2%. SYMC +9% AH. CC underway (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • AEM

    More on Agnico-Eagle Mines' (NYSE:AEM) Q3 results: Increases full-year production guidance to...

    More on Agnico-Eagle Mines' (NYSE:AEM) Q3 results: Increases full-year production guidance to ~1.025M oz. of gold from previous 975K, based on the strong performance YTD, especially at Meadowbank. Lowers expected total cash costs to ~$660/oz. from $690. Expects to produce ~990K oz. of gold in 2013, unchanged from prior forecasts. Shares +1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM

    Hill-Rom (NYSE:HRC): FQ4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $432M (flat% Y/Y) beats by $14M. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)

  • CLF

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF) Q3 results: Lowers its full-year expectation...

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources' (NYSE:CLF) Q3 results: Lowers its full-year expectation for Chinese crude steel production to ~715M tons from previous 730M. Lowers its average full-year 2012 seaborne iron ore spot price expectation to ~$128/ton from previous $154. Shares -6.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • FFIV

    More on F5's FQ4: The company says it's seeing smaller deal sizes, particularly among U.S....

    More on F5's FQ4: The company says it's seeing smaller deal sizes, particularly among U.S. enterprise and telecom customers. U.S. revenue growth (+16% Y/Y) trailed international growth (+24%). FQ1 guidance blamed on macro issues and seasonality. Deferred revenue balance reached $447.3M, +3% Q/Q and +30% Y/Y. The report arguably has negative implications for Citrix, Radware, and Riverbed. It looks like Barclays was on the mark. CC underway (webcast). FFIV -10.7% AH. RDWR -1.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM | 2 Comments

  • SYNC

    More on Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC): Company posts an in-line Q3 on an 18% Y/Y jump in total revenue....

    More on Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC): Company posts an in-line Q3 on an 18% Y/Y jump in total revenue. Search and display advertising revenue +24%, subscription-based revenue -3%. The company averaged 20.2M unique visitors per month, an increase of 44% Y/Y. Search queries were 234M, an increase of 15% from the third quarter of 2011. Advertising impressions grew 51% to 11.6B, compared to 7.7B in Q311. Shares -7.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reshuffles its executive team, with U.S. Business President Mike Vitelli to...

    Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) reshuffles its executive team, with U.S. Business President Mike Vitelli to retire at year's end, and EVP of U.S. Operations Tim Sheehan to leave at the end of the month. Seeing FQ3 trends following that of recent quarters, the company says FQ3 earnings will be "significantly below the prior-year period." Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)

    F5 Networks (NASDAQ:FFIV): FQ4 EPS of $1.12 misses by $0.06. Revenue of $362.6M (+15% Y/Y) misses by $3.2M. Expects FQ1 revenue of $363M-$370M and EPS of $1.14-$1.16, below a consensus of $373.5M and $1.20. Shares -11% AH. (PR)

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA): Q3 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $255.6M (-11% Y/Y) misses by...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA): Q3 EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $255.6M (-11% Y/Y) misses by $0.8M. Expects 2012 bookings of $1.09B-$1.1B, in-line with lowered guidance. Expects 2012 EPS of $0.02-$0.03, below consensus of $0.04. Announces $200M stock buyback plan and partnership with U.K. online gambling site bwin.party. Shares +11.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 4 Comments
  • WYNN

    More on Wynn Resorts' (NASDAQ:WYNN) Q2: Macau revenue fell 4.3% Y/Y to $910.5M with table game...

    More on Wynn Resorts' (NASDAQ:WYNN) Q2: Macau revenue fell 4.3% Y/Y to $910.5M with table game turnover lower. Las Vegas revenue rose 11.8% to $388M with table win percentage and table games drop both looking quite solid. The $8.00-per-share special dividend is inclusive of the normal $0.50 quarterly dividend. The casino operator hikes its future dividend payout to $1.00 a share. An earnings conference call is scheduled for 4:30 PM EST. (webcast). Shares +3.4% AH (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM | 2 Comments

    Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS): Q3 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $641M (+13% Y/Y) misses...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO): FQ1 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $118.1M (+59% Y/Y) beats by...

    Fusion-io (NYSE:FIO): FQ1 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $118.1M (+59% Y/Y) beats by $7.1M. Expects FQ2 revenue to be "essentially flat" Q/Q, below a $125M consensus. Shares -14.5% AH. (PR)

    Akamai Technologies (NASDAQ:AKAM): Q3 EPS of $0.43 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $345M (+23% Y/Y)...

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Q3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $295.6M (+7.5% Y/Y) misses by...

    Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Q3 EPS of $0.49 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $295.6M (+7.5% Y/Y) misses by $7M. Shares -6.3% Ah. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • NSC

    Norfolk Southern's (NSC -7.5%) dismal Q3 results prompt three downgrades, including Citigroup's...

    Norfolk Southern's (NSC -7.5%) dismal Q3 results prompt three downgrades, including Citigroup's reduction of its stock rating to Neutral from Buy. "Earnings headwinds are likely to persist into 1H13 due to sharp Y/Y declines in export coal volumes and the company's relative inability to manage short term costs in a weak volume environment," Citi writes. Also, CSX -3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 7 Comments
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN -2.5%) is closing with losses ahead of tomorrow's Q3 report after Barclays cut...

    Amazon (AMZN -2.5%) is closing with losses ahead of tomorrow's Q3 report after Barclays cut estimates, citing slowing revenue growth. Though still taking share from e-commerce and bricks & mortar rivals alike, Amazon has been struggling to deal with Europe's macro and forex headwinds, and now also has U.S. sales tax collections to contend with. Some concerns are priced in: shares are down 12% from their Oct. 4 close.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR -2%) shares reverse course, turning south as quarterly results settle in....

    Nabors Industries (NBR -2%) shares reverse course, turning south as quarterly results settle in. CEO Tony Petrello says NBR is planning close to $1B of disposals in the next year to meet debt reduction targets, despite struggles to offload certain assets. Apart from Eagle Ford property that should be sold by the year end, sales of E&P assets are effectively on hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • TMO

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +4.8%) gains after its Q3 beats consensus estimates. Net profit rose 9.4%...

    Thermo Fisher (TMO +4.8%) gains after its Q3 beats consensus estimates. Net profit rose 9.4% Y/Y, as the supplier of analytical technologies and laboratory products posted stronger-than-expected revenue growth. The company also raised its FY12 estimate above Street estimates, to between $4.81 and $4.88 a share on revenue of $12.3B to $12.4B.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • AVGO

    While Facebook leads an Internet stock rally, chip stocks have sold off over the course of the...

    While Facebook leads an Internet stock rally, chip stocks have sold off over the course of the day (SOXX -1.3%). Broadcom (BRCM -2.9%) and Altera's (ALTR -8%) guidance (I, II) is taking a toll, and the Street might also be concerned about the implications of EMC and Juniper's guidance. During its earnings call, Broadcom said it expected its networking/wireline infrastructure chip sales to be weak in Q4, due to both soft enterprise and service provider spending.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA +13%) moves up after beating on its Q3 bottom and top line numbers today. The...

    NuVasive (NUVA +13%) moves up after beating on its Q3 bottom and top line numbers today. The company lowers guidance going forward, now expecting FY12 revenue of between $601M to $606M on earnings of $0.88 to $0.90 per share. However, the company also noted that it's aggressively moving to replenish its diminished salesforce that led to flat third-quarter sales growth in its spinal division.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFX

    Shares of Newfield Exploration (NFX -16%) plunge after the oil and gas producer reported Q3...

    Shares of Newfield Exploration (NFX -16%) plunge after the oil and gas producer reported Q3 earnings and revenues below analyst expectations. “The stock is getting hammered because they talked about how international oil volumes could be down up to 25% in 2013, which hit these guys pretty hard,” an RBC Capital analyst says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • WINT

    Discovery Lab (DSCO -12.5%) tanks after saying the commercial launch of its Surfaxin liquid...

    Discovery Lab (DSCO -12.5%) tanks after saying the commercial launch of its Surfaxin liquid medication to treat Infant Respiratory Distress Syndrome will likely be delayed until Q2 of 2013. Expectations had been for it to be released by the end of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • IRBT

    iRobot (IRBT -18.7%) plans to cut up to 13% of its workforce, according to the Boston Globe. The...

    iRobot (IRBT -18.7%) plans to cut up to 13% of its workforce, according to the Boston Globe. The company slashed its revenue guidance by 45% with the home robot market developing slowly.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD -1.7%) is selling off for the second day in a row. Yesterday, SA's Gray Wolf...

    3D Systems (DDD -1.7%) is selling off for the second day in a row. Yesterday, SA's Gray Wolf Research offered a lengthy bear case for the 3D printer maker: it argued 3D's organic revenue growth is overstated thanks to acquisitions; that it's losing share after having "significantly underinvested" in R&D relative to Stratasys (SSYS -0.2%) and other rivals; and (citing sources) that 1H results were inflated by channel-stuffing from recently-acquired Z Corp.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 7 Comments
  • NRG

    NRG Energy (NRG +1.7%) subsidiary NRG Bluewater wins a federal lease to place turbines off...

    NRG Energy (NRG +1.7%) subsidiary NRG Bluewater wins a federal lease to place turbines off the coast of Delaware, giving the power generation company a valuable asset if the wind industry can recover. But development of the offshore wind farm has remained on hold since December, when NRG terminated its contract with Delmarva Power after failing to obtain financing.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • CMG

    Einhorn vs. Chipotle, Round 2: Greenlight Capital's bearish stance on Chipotle (CMG +1.2%)...

    Einhorn vs. Chipotle, Round 2: Greenlight Capital's bearish stance on Chipotle (CMG +1.2%) doesn't budge an inch with the firm continuing to hold on to its view that the new menu from Taco Bell (YUM +0.2%) will be a major drag on the restaurant chain's sales. A survey by the hedge fund found a high percentage of Chiptole customers sampled the Cantina Bell menu after its launch, with 50% rating it equal or better fare. (Greenlight Capital letter .pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 6 Comments
  • GMCR

    Greenlight Capital issues its Q3 letter to investors with Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR...

    Greenlight Capital issues its Q3 letter to investors with Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.1%) once again firmly in the hedge fund's sights. Major points: 1) Einhorn maintains it's implausible a GMCR audit committee completed an investigation of issues in only 23 days. 2) The effect of the launch of the Verismo brewer has been trivialized by GMCR management. 3) GMCR recently lowered its K-Cup pricing by $0.08, marking the full amount of profit per K-Cup it booked last quarter. (Greenlight Capital letter .pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • REGN

    Regeneron (REGN +5.8%) gains after blowing away Q3 estimates earlier this morning. Total...

    Regeneron (REGN +5.8%) gains after blowing away Q3 estimates earlier this morning. Total revenues soared over 300% Y/Y on strong demand for Eylea, REGN's injection for the treatment of neovascular age-related macular degeneration. Sales of the drug were up 26% from 2Q. The company boost its sales estimates again for the year, and notes that Eylea should further fuel growth in 2013 following recent FDA approval for its expanded use.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.7%) peek their head over the $25 mark before...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +3.7%) peek their head over the $25 mark before falling back. Partially lost in the debate over the entry of new K-cup market players is the dynamic that the company has been slowly easing up its profits on its Keurig brewers.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • UIS

    Unisys (UIS -13.9%) plummets as its Q3 EPS beat (assisted by rising hardware margins) is...

    Unisys (UIS -13.9%) plummets as its Q3 EPS beat (assisted by rising hardware margins) is overshadowed by a revenue miss caused by a 15% Y/Y drop in services revenue. U.S. sales (-24% Y/Y) were particularly weak, thanks to a big drop in federal demand, and hardware revenue fell 10%, as rising server/mainframe sales were offset by lower reseller revenue. The results could have negative implications for bigger mainframe/services rival IBM. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • MWW

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -9.3%) falls as trader sentiment leans toward the company staying off the...

    Monster Worldwide (MWW -9.3%) falls as trader sentiment leans toward the company staying off the radar of P-E firms for a while. Shares now trade at a two-month low.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • BKH

    Black Hills (BKH +1.6%) is initiated by RBC Capital at Outperform with a $39 price target, as...

    Black Hills (BKH +1.6%) is initiated by RBC Capital at Outperform with a $39 price target, as the firm expects 8.7% three-year compounded annual EPS growth forecast from 2011-14 driven by consistent rate base growth at the electric and utilities segments, and moderate production and sales growth at the oil and gas E&P segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • BWLD

    It wasn't what was said at Buffalo Wild Wings' (BWLD -12%) earnings conference call (transcript)...

    It wasn't what was said at Buffalo Wild Wings' (BWLD -12%) earnings conference call (transcript) that was interesting to dealReporter, but what wasn't chatted up. After two consecutive earnings calls that broached the topic of adding a new concept to the company's growth plan, execs were mute on the topic last night.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments
  • BCR

    Medical-device firm C.R. Bard (BCR -2.5%) dips on a mixed Q3, with net profit roughly flat Y/Y...

    Medical-device firm C.R. Bard (BCR -2.5%) dips on a mixed Q3, with net profit roughly flat Y/Y as sales rose less than expected. The company blames the shortfall on a weakness in its U.S. market, where sales fell roughly 1%. Sales were stronger abroad, rising about 3%. Sales in its vascular business, its largest, were down 2.7%, while its urology unit posted a 3.2% rise. The company also announced plans to acquire privately held Neomend, a developer of sprayable surgical sealants and anti-adhesion products, for $140M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM

    C.H. Robinson Worldwide (CHRW -3.9%) slips after its Q3 missed estimates late yesterday. Net profit inched higher Y/Y, rising 1.7% on improving sales in its key trucking segment and its sourcing and payment services divisions. Revenue in the overall transportation group, its largest revenue source, improved 2.2%, with truckload volumes gaining about 8%. Those gains were offset by higher operational costs and weakness in other areas, as intermodal revenue slipped 4.4% and air revenue fell 9%.

  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators (LL +13.8%) moves up after its Q3 beat across the board this morning, as the...

    Lumber Liquidators (LL +13.8%) moves up after its Q3 beat across the board this morning, as the closeout flooring retailer racks up another solid quarter. Total revenue jumped nearly 19% Y/Y as same-store sales rose 12% and traffic climbed 12%. The company also raised full year guidance again, now expecting to earn between $1.53 to $1.59, up from its prior view of $1.30 to $1.42. It also lifts revenue projections to between $791M and $799M, versus previous estimates of $750M to $775M.
